title: Queen of All Saints History/Geography Course: Grade 7
subject: History/Geography

document.title: Queen of All Saints Curriculum Book

CCCA4FB806484339BF1154B7872BD571.description: Compare the geographical features of Australia and Papua New Guinea.

946591D55C6F49238AC78A8B4C0CD38F.description: Compare the cultural and physical geography of Lebanon and Iran.

07B19637E92C4BEE89A7B34384FA33D9.description: Compare the human and physical geography of the Nile River Basin and the Sahara Desert.

2D6EAF45E5DB4AECA7F4A3C53BEE7790.description: Analyze and compare the human and physical geography of a small area in Canada and Mexico.

5C49C9AB0D384E06878F087F591EB1BE.description: Compare the human and geographical features of a small area in Western Europe and in Eastern Europe.

02A207B603E94D4F9C067757A148DADD.description: Compare the geographical similarities and differences between two countries in different regions or places within the same region, focusing on the major country studied.

38ED38DD821D4C02BE0C4819BBDA3A61.description: Analyze the effects of the Himalayas on the climate, biogeography, and cultures of surrounding countries.

43E52C0D363E4A8DAF38A43FA1CBD42D.description: Evaluate the impact of physical geography on everyday activities in the Amazon Basin.

CF67D3E04CD44BD7A76902CC6C157C31.description: Identify the environmental and physical geography of the Caribbean Islands.

B0E997CAFA4149038D0835A2875D55B9.description: Know that the Grand Canyon is one of the seven natural wonders of the world and is located in Arizona

ED5DB63492A143AEB36718313D289F2C.description: Identify one or two key aspects of the biogeography, physical or cultural geography of a major country in each region studied.

1A325E46D1BB46FBA2DB026170C3B4A7.description: Spell all countries in North Africa correctly.

0A77E4B23B6D4C39ADC2074485661600.description: Spell all countries in Oceania and their capitals correctly.

00DBDBD88E744D75950EE3C22E179E71.description: Spell all countries in Asia and their capitals correctly.

397AF329075D4E8DB40F97A60C16B63D.description: Spell all countries in the Middle East and their capitals correctly.

F978ED0ECB36405EA0BD269AC60FD432.description: Spell all countries in Africa correctly.

AE832FD72B4B4F32AAC9A0F09F2D1AF5.description: Spell all countries in South America and their capitals correctly.

729E8E5CE589484B8901FA8F8B785618.description: Spell all countries in the Caribbean Islands and Central America and their capitals correctly.

56EB6E827F21423BB9DBCE56FBCC5230.description: Spell all countries in North America and their capitals correctly.

14AF468FE6304311AF90D534FD0EAE31.description: Spell all countries in Europe and their capitals correctly.

2036DD84A6674101BEC7EBAD69A66876.description: Spell the names of countries/capitals correctly.

DAFD308A79404C6199D2A1A96FAC2AA7.description: Students will be able to spell all 50 states and their capitals correctly.

53636920ACD9495EA0EC5CD19B8152A1.description: Spell the New England states, the Mid-Atlantic states, the Great Lakes states, and the Southwestern states and their capitals correctly.

657EF96CF2AF47158E587E174C27E833.description: Spell the states/capitals of the US correctly.

730EFBA648E44904BDE97642711CF465.description: Locate all countries in North Africa on a map.

1A3D63E9AB324E46B6B05B7DC0013E30.description: Locate all countries in Oceania and their capitals on a map.

D1585DD9B8E24450A2600F8D17801DD3.description: Locate all countries in Asia and their capitals on a map.

AE1AB9E1C03F49D1B4E69FEEE3B9505D.description: Locate all countries in the Middle East and their capitals on a map.

7253059A664E4FA5B4094E7742350FC3.description: Locate all countries in Africa on a map.

6BE90FF770E64A08ACE1C7BE684FFA9A.description: Locate all countries in South America and their capitals on a map.

DC9D937C8D3B4ABDAB09355C279BC321.description: Locate all countries in the Caribbean Islands and Central America and their capitals on a map.

86A345FC16034B2A949336BD047DEA8B.description: Locate all countries in North America and their capitals on a map.

3D0572287CFC4482A940B7E667F5D772.description: Locate all countries in Europe and their capitals on a map.

D613C97A264D4C96AADC9C0D74E2D4A7.description: Know the location of all countries and be able to name their capitals.

4E4C4FCB667E4ABFA30763C6B38B903D.description: Locate all 50 states and their capitals on a map.

E63807B872CC436094DCB29561697422.description: Locate the New England states, the Mid-Atlantic states, the Great Lakes states, and the Southwestern states and their capitals on a map.

B9A673A59CA04FFBBF62C45F223B688D.description: Know the location of the U.S. states and be able to name their capitals.

AC7E6EC4C52946D3B72284955E5E8DB7.description: Analyze the roles of St. Bernard of Clairvaux, King Philip II "Augustus," and King St. Louis IX in the development and consolidation of the French monarchy.

28B86554DF7044328AE815A04178DD7B.description: Describe the founding of the Capetian Dynasty by Hugh Capet and the contributions of Abbot Suger to the strengthening of the French monarchy.

B9148CCDFC2A47FA836ABA16F234CF82.description: Describe the conflicts and developments during the reigns of St. Thomas Becket, Richard the Lion-Heart, King John Lackland, and the significance of the Magna Carta, the first parliament under King Henry III, and the reign of King Edward I "Longshanks."

5F1EEE0B9C864DE0B9CE7EF6DC9DC243.description: Examine the development of the English monarchy under Henry II, including the beginning of the House of Plantagenet, the influence of Eleanor of Aquitaine.

AE7371CFB4104393970A064CCBE9C631.description: Explain the events and significance of the Norman Conquest of England, and analyze the reigns of William the Conqueror, William Rufus, and Henry I.

2856AEDF76684AD7BC1E3ED02BB70D59.description: Describe the role of El Cid Campeador in the early stages of the Reconquest and his significance in Spanish history and culture.

8BE41BC0144E440D8C544793B92C343E.description: The New Nations: Spain, England, and France: Understand the formation and development of new nations in medieval Europe, focusing on the Reconquest in Spain, the growth of the English monarchy, and the strengthening of the French monarchy.

5DFAE4C47ACE425E9CD43C5EFA5C084B.description: Analyze the conflict between Pope Gregory VII and Emperor Henry IV over investiture and explain the resolution of this conflict through the Concordat of Worms.

7C9A0ED8182A48B1A905338BE1D501CE.description: Explain the establishment and significance of the College of Cardinals as the pope's new electors, and describe the reforms initiated by Pope St. Gregory VII.

D45EC34EE3414AAFABF34F357AC85C1B.description: Explain the roles and contributions of the Cistercians, Norbertines, and Carthusians in the broader monastic reform movement.

F331656F477B4221AD37FDE315CB8270.description: Describe the origins and significance of the Cluny reform movement, including the establishment of the Truce of God and the Peace of God.

EEA2904EFABE4806831E691DD4F61A58.description: Identify and describe the various abuses in the medieval Church, including the roles of bishops and abbots as vassals of secular lords, lay investiture, simony.

08587A17B1194C0D8BE2BD4CAA8D42CF.description: The Medieval Reformation: Understand the challenges and reforms within the medieval Church and their impact on religious and political life in Europe.

76C33B51CE9E4BBA80FD51DF5D0AEC82.description: Describe the structure and functions of town governments and analyze the role of guilds in regulating trade and craftsmanship.

AF9DECD5F2464FE68F66B83AF0643734.description: Evaluate the impact of medieval inventions on agricultural productivity and the drive to the East for new resources and opportunities.

913312E3CABC4EA3836FF8F0966A14C8.description: Explain the roles and daily lives of lords, serfs, and freemen within the feudal manor, and describe the farm economy and its significance for medieval society.

07B225476B8E4B6AB1C346A6A258C6A8.description: Analyze the function and organization of the feudal manor, including the agricultural and economic practices that sustained it.

0FD0FE94034948268E5DA6875E031D43.description: Describe the structure of feudal relationships, focusing on the roles and obligations of lords and vassals, and explain the significance of knighthood and chivalry in feudal society.

BA4109E2CA9043A0871F933E1E63070C.description: The Achievements of Feudalism—A.D. 800–1008: Understand the development of the feudal system and its impact on medieval European society, economy, and governance.

988364E585504CEC84018AF8FC78075D.description: Examine Charles the Great's legal and cultural reforms and assess the significance of his coronation as Roman Emperor in shaping medieval European history.

FE662085C8284193A3F04DE3D6B045DD.description: Describe the rise of Pepin the Short and the establishment of the Carolingian dynasty.

F03201C7E49941A5B3BFB74D2B94D05D.description: Evaluate the significance of the Battle of Tours in halting the Muslim advance into Western Europe.

BD578112307444749D66D86681A12B8B.description: Explain the roles of Sts. Willibrord and Boniface in the conversion of Germany and the impact of their missionary work on European Christianity.

46A6339C89064FBC8B70503C238E17EA.description: Describe the events and significance of Emir Tarik's conquest of Spain and the beginnings of the Reconquest.

1E99F771414E4F9090B51A9AB8744601.description: The Defense and Building of Christendom: Understand the efforts to defend and build Christendom in the face of external threats and internal developments during the early Middle Ages.

FE8EF3E6D3BE49D6900AF61A298B4905.description: Describe the major conquests and territorial expansions under the Umayyad Caliphate, emphasizing the development of Islamic sea power and the conquest of Spain.

8D99B4457F9E475EB6F2DE6EB63955D6.description: Evaluate the administrative, cultural, and social changes brought about by Islamic rule in these newly conquered territories.

BDA0C7CB1EBD472E8E42FDE91914B9F6.description: Analyze the military and strategic successes of early Islamic conquests, focusing on the expansion into Syria and Palestine, Persia, and Egypt and North Africa.

0E278FD4C0F04083B570FFBE422E2569.description: Explain the key events in the beginnings of Islam.

CBF48588C22C421AB1F53D27FE4B7CE2.description: Describe Muhammad's early life and the socio-political context of Arabia before the rise of Islam.

0644A5331213499A8E5F73E5EB905A6A.description: The Rise of Islam—A.D. 624–800: Understand the origins, expansion, and early development of Islam and its impact on the surrounding regions.

4913AD82F6FD4BE785788E0E6CDAD4A1.description: Examine the roles of Pope St. Gregory the Great and St. Augustine of Canterbury in shaping the Christian West, including the conflict between Gaelic and Roman Christians.

DFBCC43309D14E4AA64530535ADAFC0D.description: Explore the contributions of St. Patrick of Ireland, Boethius, and St. Benedict of Nursia to the development of Western Christianity.

2CCD5E1214324CE2873EDD82CF09196D.description: Examine the lives and influences of Empress Theodora and Justinian, focusing on social policies, the Nika Revolt, and the construction of Hagia Sophia.

132E88967E8D4DD0A514D63532C022FB.description: Founders of Christendom—A.D. 500–700: Understand the significant figures and events that shaped the foundations of Christendom in the early Middle Ages.

F2DC5BC688FC42269CB5F674ADE8F816.description: Examine the rise and influence of the Mayors of the Palace, including Pepin the Younger and Charles Martel, in the consolidation and expansion of the Frankish kingdom.

71572E5211E84C33BF7E69C71DB4D3A0.description: Describe the origins and early history of the Franks, focusing on the Merovingian dynasty and the conversion of Clovis to Christianity.

06A3E0201B834160A75C5A38C65CB6AB.description: Examine the significance of the conversion of the Visigoths from Arianism to Catholicism.

63E714BB534B4E8685BA16C6A6B27DD0.description: Describe the migration and settlement of the Visigoths in Gaul and the Iberian Peninsula.

30FCAC2EB5AE442994FE149636D2EA09.description: Germanic Kingdoms in the West: Understand the establishment and development of Germanic kingdoms in the post-Roman West and their interactions with Roman culture and Christianity.

0F9DDEB6F91148EA9C928132251B73FF.description: Examine the leadership and achievements of Pope St. Leo the Great and analyze his role in defending the Church against external threats and internal heresies.

277CF54E4F554D7D8617B6F8A0FF4138.description: Describe the life and works of St. Jerome and St. Augustine of Hippo, focusing on their theological contributions and opposition to Pelagianism.

3173FA0072EA437CA5B9344D18B023B5.description: Explore the contributions of St. Ambrose of Milan to the Church and his influence on Church-State relations.

0A9944C1155F463E85403B7EC83866FD.description: Examine the contributions of St. Basil of Caesarea to the development of monastic communities.

10C926884CEB40B496315E0D09F1751A.description: Explore the life and influence of St. Anthony as a pioneer of Christian monasticism and describe the life of hermits and cenobites.

3BD8661395A84671B51E5F4EF1BFC0EF.description: Describe the purpose and outcomes of the Council of Nicaea and analyze the trials of Athanasius in defending orthodox Christianity.

00870A255BDA4AE0BBA13AEE804D66CC.description: Explain the origins and key issues of Arianism and discuss the Church's response to this heresy.

A92FF3E1DA0C43EC8246330B0D7B364D.description: The Christian Empire: Analyze the development and challenges of the early Christian Church and its influence on the Roman Empire.

17F7366C3AF64884B047B80B6C9525E1.description: Explain the provisions and impact of the Edict of Milan on the Catholic Faith in society and discuss the founding of Constantinople and its strategic and cultural importance.

1075B1FA03FF468092D8465002679BCA.description: Describe the events and significance of the Battle of Milvian Bridge and analyze how Constantine's victory influenced his conversion to Christianity.

E383F09AA6B4490184376C182CB0567B.description: The Blood of the Martyrs: Understand the pivotal role of Constantine in the transformation of the Roman Empire and the establishment of Christianity as a dominant religion.

1961AB4B5CA342FD8BC8016678259D76.description: Explain Diocletian’s decision to move the Roman capital to the East and analyze the effects of this reform on the administration and stability of the Roman Empire Explain.

C4D86027AF5E48868B3770BB47CEE7DA.description: Describe the first imperial persecution of Christians under Nero and discuss the broader implications for the early Church.

1A1FF4B8EE034B65AA1681A4C6E782AB.description: Investigate the reigns of Nero and Titus, focusing on their policies, actions, and impacts on the Roman Empire and its society.

F58E5D6B913D4C289F1B16764A9DDAE8.description: Explain the concept of Pax Romana, its impact on the Roman Empire's stability and prosperity, and assess Augustus’s role in promoting arts and addressing social issues during his reign.

EA8823939A3A4E32AA52F36C6DEDB069.description: Describe the structure and significance of the principate established by Augustus Caesar and analyze how it marked the transition from the Roman Republic to the Roman Empire.

AD9DA4D9DDE64640B4F99908BAEA0828.description: Emperors and Madmen: Understand the political, cultural, and social transformations in the Roman Empire from Augustus Caesar to Diocletian, focusing on the imperial persecutions, key emperors and significant reforms.

30F9D6BD16694362B743692E84B202AA.description: Students should be able to summarize a discussion using the summarizer sentence frames.

256E64C2E0974D588D9A58A0DEE9B0B5.description: Students should be able to challenge an opinion during a discussion using the challenger sentence frames.

0D7317DCA06648CFA6077704F1E356D0.description: Students should be able to build on an opinion during a discussion using the builder sentence frames.

47F17DD393A64F7B8E511E8E359CBF67.description: Students should start a discussion using the instigator sentence frames.

04D381FEA832402DA7EC0F944A11E1A1.description: Students should develop “Habits of Discussion” using the different topics covered during history class.

CEEAFA86C62F49A3BBEE7D20CCFB41D3.description: Students should be able to draw a practical lesson of conduct from historical events and actions using the VIP (Virtue-Impact-Practice) method and sentence frames.

97C277A8F85A43B1815E777DACD0534E.description: Students should be able to judge the morality of historical personages and actions using the CER (Claim-Evidence-Reasoning) method and a sentence frame.

4EAE5F8DD4F346699BFAD28519C508A9.description: Students should be able to judge the causes and effects of historical events using the CER (Claim-Evidence-Reasoning) method and a sentence frame. They should be able to formulate and write this response in 5 minutes.

AD5836A46EBD44EEA621002A017E80B5.description: Students should be able to judge the causes and effects of historical events using the CER (Claim-Evidence-Reasoning) method and a sentence frame.
